newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan economy better now than few months ago - EPA.
newsitem.headline: Japan economy better now than few months ago - EPA.

text.p: Japan's economy is better now than it was a few months ago, newly appointed Economic Planning Agency (EPA) minister Taro Aso told a news conference on Friday.
Aso said that Japan may be able to achieve its official growth target of 2.5 percent set for the current fiscal year ending March 31.
"There was feeling a few months ago that the economy was marking time, but the economy is definitely better now and continuing its gradual growth," he said.
Deregulation will help the economy pick up its pace of recovery, he added.
"However, we have to keep in mind the unemployment rate may go up because of deregulation," he said.
Asked if a supplementary budget to stimulate the economy was needed, Aso said he doubts if an extra budget can be implemented within the current fiscal year.
"Theoretically, a supplementary budget may have good effects on the economy, but we have to assess if we really need that now," he added.
